DOC.brief_summary: The principal objective trial demonstrate acupuncture could reduce caesarean section rate cervical dystocia . Secondary objective : To demonstrate acupuncture : - reduce morbidity , fetal mortality duration childbirth ; - reduce cost care , due diminution caesarean section duration obstetric labor ; - evaluate tolerance .
DOC.brief_title: Randomised Controlled Trial Efficacy Acupuncture Versus Placebo Caesarean Section Rate Case Cervical Dystocia Full-term Pregnancy
DOC.detailed_description: In trial , pregnant woman least 37 week amenorrhea randomize traditional chinese acupuncture , sham acupuncture , usual care . 9 investigator site participate trial target enrol 2220 patient total . 1780 subject receive acupuncture treatment , either effective treatment sham , whereas 400 patient receive usual care . Acupuncture therapy consist stimulation specific skin point abdominal area , specific acupuncture point traditional chinese medicine induction obstetric labor , accord professional recommendation French Acupuncture Traditional Chinese Medicine College . Each patient 5-week follow-up trial .
DOC.criteria: Aged â‰¥ 18 year Signed informed consent Woman carry one foetus 37 week ( +/ 2 day ) amenorrhea Without contraindication vaginal delivery Prior history caesarean section Noncephalic presentation Fetal macrosomia Multiple pregnancy Chronic fetal hypoxia Placenta praevia Risk neonatal contamination
